title: Solution for the LeaverBuster system.
body:
I was just thinking of a new method of how the LeaverBuster should work. It's the same method used right now except a small additional feature for Summoners to experience. As we know, the LeaverBuster system puts you into a timer of 20 minutes (Yes, its pretty annoying to stay 20 minutes).
Now just imagine, these are some situations you might go through.
1. A summoner goes through the Timer and joins the queue. Finally, he accepts the game but his prompted with the warning "Active Game Not Found". This can be caused due to minor issues either with Riot or your ISP.
2. A Summoner Forgets to Accept the game or accidentally clicks on Decline (This is a very rare situation when some people forget about the leaver queue) 
3. Summoner Accidentally quits the Queue to invite one of his/her friend(s) and unfortunately forgets the fact that he was in the leaver queue
(Some of the situations above might be stupid but Yes, it happens to many people)

Now getting in these situations is one of the most annoying things which could happen. This is where my solution comes in. Riot can implement a new solution as  in case this situation occurs, the Summoner would be able to rejoin the queue without being prompted by the LeaverBuster timer. Yes, it might sound stupid because summoners can keep the LeaverBuster open at times they don't play and when they play they can straight away join the queue. This is the reason why i thought of allowing the Summoner to rejoin back to the queue within the next 5 minutes or else they would be prompted again with the LeaverBuster Timer. 

Basically what im trying to show is that If a summoner is put on the LeaverBuster system, and unfortunately a situation occurs where they actually left the queue, they would be able to join the queue again without being prompted by the LeaverBuster within the next 5 minutes or else they should go through the LeaverBuster timer again.

This is just a solution i think would be cool if Riot implemented it on League of Legends.
Feel free to comment below what you think about it and Please mind my English Grammar skills.

replies.body:
Wait a second.
The aim of Leaverbuster isn't to randomly annoy leavers (although, hey, we'd all like it). it's to make them realize something is wrong, either behaviourally or technically.
If they have a technical problem, they should fix it, not get workarounds to still get into the game.
As for 2 and 3... I guess 2 might have a point. For 3... i guess i'd be laughing for at least the first 5 minutes, if i had leavers as friends...
Not all leavers are trolls with no lives, 3 is much more likely to happen than 2

Definitely true, but it's also a lot easier to fix.
There's a sound effect and (at least with the settings i have) the window automatically refocuses to League when a game is found, the only time i fail accepting are when i'm running for the toilet... Cmon.

I think the main problem here is that Riot is taking a solution that is easy enough for trolls to bypass, and yet hard enough for everyone else to deal with normally.

You should just be allowed to pause a queue rather than quit it, as it's a bit harsh to remove someone who went to the toilet from the queue, like the current system.

Cheaters just set up a timer with an alarm and wait out their 40 minutes by reading a book, which isn't countered by the current system.

There really isn't any good way to deal with the second, but Riot tries to do so anyway and ends up creating the first problem.
I don't think you're supposed to sit in front of a still screen for all the queue time, mate...

>
> I don't think you're supposed to sit in front of a still screen for all the queue time, mate...

Then my point is even more valid, Riot's current system just inconveniences people on purpose.

> [{quoted}](name=TeCoolMage,realm=OCE,application-id=FjGAIbRv,discussion-id=WE7I5kZs,comment-id=000000000000000000010000,timestamp=2015-06-14T06:42:06.184+0000)
>
> Then my point is even more valid, Riot's current system just inconveniences people on purpose.

And all because those people ***leave games***.

And not all of those people are trolls with no lives, the ones that _are_ cheat the system, and the ones who are unlucky actually wait it out.

It's like having a jail that's extremely easy to break out of, but instead of increasing security, all prisoners are put on deathrow, even if they are falsely accused.  Now everyone wants to escape. Before, people who are fair will wait it out as they don't want to end up on any wanted signs, and put on a more secure prison, while the bad guys walk out the front doors and get tracked down.

It's not like that at all actually. It's quite simple really. These people ***consistently*** leave games (whether they make the conscious choice or not), putting 4 people at a disadvantage and ruining the game for as many as 9 people ***every time it happens***, and get put in LPQ. They then have the ***choice*** to watch the LPQ screen for as long as 20 minutes or go do something else while they wait.
Some don't leave intentionally. They want to play, however ISP issues like Laggs and pings make it harder for them to play.

It doesn't matter if people leave intentionally or not, the fact is they've left consistently enough to be hit with LPQ. Any way you look at it it's the fault of the player, whether they made the conscious decision to leave or have not ensured they meet the connection requirements of the game (which everyone agrees to do via the TOU and EULA).
Please read what i have mentioned. I have said nothing about taking off the LPQ system. I just mentioned a Solution which could be done so that its rather a more fair based LPQ system.

> I have said nothing about taking off the LPQ system.

Neither have I.

> I just mentioned a Solution which could be done so that its rather a more fair based LPQ system.

You've put forth a means by which a punishment would be more lenient. Punishments are **designed** to be unfair.

"Fair Based" meaning the leaver queue should be unfair but at the same time it should make sense out of it because the summoner obviously has stayed a total time of 20 minutes and deserves at least 2-5 minutes to rejoin back to the queue without being prompted.

The problem is, when they go do something else while, the system is made in a way that implies watching the screen is actually preferred. If LPQ is there simply to stop people from playing too many games rather than as a direct punishment, Riot should do a better job to reflect this.
It's there to inconvenience people who do the wrong thing. If Riot wanted to stop people playing games they could just issue a ban.

Those are just some examples. There are many other cases which eventually leads you to not Accept the queue, and the fact that you already stayed 20 Minutes can mean that you can have at least about 3 minutes to rejoin the queue without being prompted? It's not all about trolls aye cause some ISP's have problems with their systems which is not totally related to the subject. But if players have like a 3-5 minutes time to rejoin back to the queue, it would give them the punishment needed, in addition, it would also be a more useful sort of LeaverBuster for those who have problems within the time. Even the pause queue method like @TeCoolMage mentioned would be useful in the similar way as in the sense Summoners can Pause the queue and they will be put on a timer for like 10 minutes pause time if not it will return back to the queue or you can just directly resume back to the queue.
